title: [DREAMER] Standardize error handling in RLM tools file operations
overview:
The RLM tools contain extensive comments (lines 102-174) discussing the trade-offs between local and remote file operations. The code has a TODO comment and shows evidence of multiple refactoring attempts. The current strategy uses local FS with bi-directional sync, but the comments suggest this may not be ideal.

**Motivation:** Clear, consistent file operation strategy is critical for RLM reliability. The extensive comments and TODO indicate this is a source of confusion or technical debt. A clean, well-documented implementation would reduce maintenance burden and prevent bugs.

**Success criteria:**
- Resolve TODO comment at line 102
- Remove or consolidate extensive comment discussion
- Document the chosen strategy (local vs remote) clearly
- Ensure Read/Write tools are consistent in their approach
- Add error handling for sync failures

**Technical constraints:**
- Depends on the Sprite VM sync mechanism
- Must maintain compatibility with existing RLM workflows
- Changes must not break remote execution

**In scope:**
- src/agent/rlm-tools.ts:102 TODO comment
- src/agent/rlm-tools.ts:137-167 Write tool implementation
- src/agent/rlm-tools.ts:172-174 Read tool override
- Documentation of the chosen file operation strategy
**Out of scope:**
- Refactoring the entire RLM architecture
- Changes to the Sprite sync mechanism

**Signals:** priority: medium, urgency: Technical debt - confusing implementation with TODO
